title: Where to Find the Clipboard on an iPhone: 4 Simple Steps

steps.title: Open the Notes app.
steps.content: Open the Notes app. Unlike the Android clipboard , the clipboard on an iPhone is not visible. However, you can easily find text saved in the clipboard with any text-based app. [1] X Research source You can also use the Microsoft Word app, the Safari web browser , or another app that allows pasting.

steps.title: Tap the "New Notes" icon.
steps.content: Tap the "New Notes" icon. This looks like a pencil in a square at the bottom-right corner. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the text field.
steps.content: Tap the text field. A pop-up menu will open.

steps.title: Tap Paste.
steps.content: Tap Paste . Text saved in your clipboard will be pasted into your notes. [3] X Research source If you tap Paste and nothing appears, you don't have anything saved to your clipboard. To save text to your clipboard, highlight the text, tap it, and then tap Copy . You can copy links , emails, and more. [4] X Research source When you copy new text, it will override any previous text in the clipboard.
